name: [ Kickoff ] Cloud Next '17 Extended - Machine Learning // Google Cloud Spanner
description:
Location: Ace Hotel Pittsburgh

120 S Whitfield Street, Pittsburgh, PA

Date/Time: 3/31/2017 - 12:30 - 3:30

12:30 - 1:00 Registration & Networking

1:00 - 1:45 - Google Spanner - Jeremy Keen - Customer Engineer, Google

1:45 - 2:30 Google Machine Learning Session / Video From Cloud Next - Chida Chidambaram - Google Dev Group - DC

2:30 - 3:30 Machine Learning APIs - Hands On Code Lab

---

The Google Developer Group is a volunteer-run community for acquiring and sharing knowledge and ideas around new and popular technologies in the mobile, web, cloud, wearable and cognitive computing domains.

We are super excited to be kicking off a new chapter in Pittsburgh that builds on our experiences with creating community and collaboration in GDG chapters like GDG New York and GDG Washington DC.

Join us to learn more about what the Google Developer Group is about, and hear from experts on the trends and technologies to explore in 2017.  

---------------

Have a specific topic or speaker you would like us to feature? Leave us a note in the comments, or message the organizers via Meetup.

Have a venue that can host[masked] people for tech talks, workshops and signature dev events? Reach out to organizers via Meetup - we'd love to work with you.

---------------
how_to_find_us: Cloud, Google, Machine Learning, AI, API

name: Google IO Extended Pittsburgh: Machine Learning, Tensor Flow & More
description:
Google I/O is the annual signature developer conference from Google. This year Google IO ran for 3 days with over 150 recorded and livestreamed sessions covering a range of topics from Android, Google Cloud, Mobile Web, IoT & Machine Learning to AR/VR and product launches like Google Lens and more.

The main takeaway is that we are moving from a mobile-first era to an AI-first era where machine learning will power a host of new innovations and interaction experiences across all domains.

Google IO17 Extended is a community-run event where we recap key announcements from IO and provide opportunities for developers to network, learn and apply ideas to their own work or hobby projects. 

We are excited to (re) launch the GDG Pittsburgh chapter with its first IO-Extended event this year, anchored by a featured talk from Josh Gordon (Developer Advocate, Tensor Flow & Google Cloud) who spoke at IO17 on "Open Source Tensor Flow Models".

Come join us for a fun evening of networking, tech talks, codelabs and more.

AGENDA:

5:30pm Doors Open

Learn about the Google Developer Group (GDG) - who we are and what we do. GDG is a volunteer-run community so if you have an interest in speaking, helping out or organizing events with us, come say hello.

6:00pm IO 17 Recap

Watch an IO17 Recap video. Get a sense of the big announcements from IO17 on both products and developer sides.

6:30pm Featured Talk by Josh Gordon (Tensor Flow)

Josh Gordon will be here in person to recap his IO17 talk on Machine Learning & AI.

Title: Open Source TensorFlow Models

Description: Come to this talk for a tour of the latest open source TensorFlow models for Image Classification, Natural Language Processing, and Computer Generated Artwork. Along the way, Josh Gordon will share thoughts on Deep Learning, open source research, and recommended educational resources you can use to learn more.

Speaker Bio: Josh Gordon is the Developer Advocate for TensorFlow at Google. He loves teaching and has over a decade of Machine Learning experience to share. Follow him on Twitter at @random_forests

7:30pm Codelabs / Q&A

Open time for networking, discussion and Q&A. Josh will stick around to talk to those with an interest in ML/AI. We also encourage folks to bring laptops and explore one of 100+ self-guided codelabs from Google IO including three on TensorFlow & Machine Learning.

Recommended Codelab: Tensor Flow For Poets (55 mins)

8:30pm Doors Close

name: DevFest Pittsburgh 2017
description:
GDG DevFests are large, community-run developer events happening around the globe focused on community building and learning about Google’s technologies.

RSVPing on Meetup will not get you into the event. You must buy a ticket at the link below.

Ticket registration:https://ti.to/gdg-pitt/devfest-2017

Cost: $20/ticket

Agenda

10:00 - 10:45
Registration and mingle

11:00 - 11:45 
Opening Keynote - Jake Wharton on Kotlin

12:00 - 2:00
Working lunch with Codelabs (2.5 hrs) 

12:00 - 12:30
Codelab 1 - John Choi
Google Cardboard Virtual Reality

12:30 - 1:00
Codelab 2 - Anastasia Lanz
Building Beautiful Sites Faster with Material Components for the web

Building Beautiful Apps Faster with Material Components on Android (Kotlin)

Write a Material Design AngularDart Web App

1:00 - 1:30 
Codelab 3 - Caroline Hermans
Creative Coding with web development tools

1:30 - 2:00
Codelab 4 - Erin O'Toole
TensorFlow

2:15 - 3:00
Closing keynote - Casey West on Pre-trained Machine Learning

name: Machine Learning for Startups
description:
How can Machine Learning help Startups?

Join us to see how startups in Pittsburgh are using Google's technologies for Machine Learning to help their businesses. We would also invite you to tell your story and/or learn from the stories of others. This meetup will be also present the opportunity to find potential employees and network with others in the similar boat as you.

Please let us know if you'd like give a talk by filling up the form below.

https://goo.gl/forms/hugaylRk4siVhql63

If you're interested in helping us organize the event as a volunteer, please fill in this form:

https://goo.gl/forms/Vw8cJsHnJVOQDcEb2

====================AGENDA==========================

12.30 - 13.00
Check-in + Tea/Coffee snacks

13:00 - 13.30 - Introductions
Learn about the Google Developer Group (GDG) - Who we are, and what we do. GDG is a volunteer-run community so if you have an interest in speaking, helping out or organizing events with us, come to say hello.

13.30 - 14.00
FEATURE TALK: TENSORFLOW
Speaker will be announced closer to the date.

The session kicks off with an expert speech about Tensorflow usage, other ML tools and how to integrate them in your current setup. Talks about the usage of these tools for start-ups in particular.

14.00 - 15.30
FEATURE TALK: STARTUPS AND ML
Top 3 featured speakers from leading startups talk about how machine learning is helping them generate business and what are the tools that are worth integrating to help you excel. Followed by QnA session.

15.30 - 16.30 - Networking Tea

16.30 - Event Wrap up.
